newsitem.title: ITALY: Eni unit Agip reports record profit in '96.
newsitem.headline: Eni unit Agip reports record profit in '96.

text.p: Note: Agip is Eni's exploration and production arm. It said the 1996 profit was the biggest in the company's 71-year history.
Note: Agip said it had a 112 billion lire extraordinary writedown in 1996 because of an Eni decision to apply U.S. accountancy regulations concerning the value of property.
It said the increase in profitability, seen mainly in its foreign activities, was largely thanks to a 3.2 percent increase in petrol production and higher oil and natural gas prices.
Total hydrocarbons production rose 1.8 million barrel equivalent last year to 360.2 million barrel equivalent.

Hydrocarbon reserves rose 357 million barrels to 4,675 million barrels, with petrol reserves totalling 2,484 million barrels at the end of last year and natural gas reserves reaching 352.4 million cubic metres.
At the end of 1996, the Agip group had operations in 26 countries. -- Rome newsroom +396 6782501
